description: Integers of the form p^(p-1), where p is prime.
comments: Also the least refactorable number (A033950) k has the n-th prime as its least prime factor. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 28 2006
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..77
S. Colton, Refactorable Numbers - A Machine Invention, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 2, 1999, #2.
S. Colton, HR - Automatic Theory Formation in Pure Mathematics
mathematica: Table[Prime@n^(Prime@n - 1), {n, 10}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 28 2006 *)#^(#-1)&/@Prime[Range[10]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 23 2015 *)
crossrefs: These integers are refactorable - i.e., the number of divisors divides the number itself, cf. A033950.
author: Simon Colton (simonco(AT)cs.york.ac.uk)
